dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 3723 IH: Medical Device Electronic Labeling Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Obernolte (for himself, Ms. Kuster, Mr. Crenshaw, and Ms. Craig) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce

form.official-title: To amend the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act to expand the types of devices for which required labeling may be made available solely by electronic means.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Medical Device Electronic Labeling Act.

section.header: Allowing required labeling of devices to be made available solely by electronic means
section.text: Section 502(f) of the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act (21 U.S.C. 352(f)) is amended by striking prescription devices intended for use in health care facilities or by a health care professional and required labeling for in vitro diagnostic devices intended for use by health care professionals or in blood establishments and inserting devices (including in vitro diagnostic devices).
